headline: Ron Johnson Knows Who's Responsible For Ukraine Invasion, And It Is Democrats
author: Michael Mora
sentences:
CNN's "State Of The Union"
We conclude with Utah GOP Senator Mitt Romney, who to his credit had something correct to say about GOP Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene and other Republicans attending the white nationalist pep rally and expressing their love for Putin:
"Look, there is no place in either political party for this White nationalism or racism.

Considering Johnson's history of laundering so much Russian misinformation that the FBI tried in vain to get him to stop, it was kind of surprising when Johnson released this statement that called out Putin without blaming anyone else:
That, however, did not last long.

In the last five days, many GOP/rightwing media types have gone from praising Vladimir Putin and trying to justify the invasion to now suddenly trying to Ctrl-Alt-Del all their earlier talking points, in order to try to be on the right side of history, allegedly.

Alexander Vindman, Adam Schiff, and Nancy Pelosi all "weakened" Ukraine by whistleblowing and impeaching Donald Trump for extorting Ukraine for political favors, in exchange for the military aid we can all now see how desperately Ukraine needs?

"(Rep.) Marjorie Taylor Greene and (Rep.) Paul Gosar, I don't know them, but I'm reminded of that old line from the 'Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid' movie where - where one character says, 'Morons, I've got morons on my team.'

In light of the current events, Margaret Brennan asked if Cheney regretted her vote not to impeach Trump when he extorted Ukraine in his first impeachment (it can't be said enough that Trump was impeached twice).
Maybe a Bush administration official who was there during the "shock and awe" invasion of Iraq under false pretenses might want to rethink calling out war crimes.

Fox News's 'Sunday Morning Futures'
Wisconsin GOP Senator and Moscow 4th Of July vacationer Ron Johnson was on with Maria Bartiromo this weekend.
Rice, while trying to make a point about Russia's invasion, said this thing that was true, and was also true when the US invaded Iraq in 2003.
And I have to think anybody that would sit down with White nationalists and speak at their conference was certainly missing a few IQ points."

'Fox News Sunday'
Staying on Fox News, former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice appeared on the Chris Wallace-less Sunday show.
CHENEY: I don't regret my vote, I think any impeachment vote has got to be one that is based very clearly on- on the evidence.
Not because they weren't war crimes, because they were, but because it seems a bit like throwing stones in a glass house.

ABC's 'This Week'
Not everybody has the courage to condemn Donald Trump's adoring comments about Vladimir Putin.
RICE: Well...I'd...I'd...it is certainly against every principle of international law and international order.

CBS's 'Face The Nation'
Wyoming GOP Rep. Liz Cheney reminded people that there is no good Republican.
Here's Arkansas GOP senator and second-place winner in an Ichabod Crane Lookalike Contest Tom Cotton.
It's simply wrong ... it's evil as well," Romney told CNN's Dana Bash on "State of the Union."
FAULKNER: Well, I've argued that when you invade a sovereign nation, that is a war crime.
Conservatives are having a weird time responding to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
I mean...I think we are at just a real basic...basic point there.
Johnson blamed some new people on the Maria Bartiromo show.
If you love Wonkette, pony up with some donations!
Wonkette is fully funded by readers like you.
How often would you like to donate?
Couldn't say it better myself.
So that was embarrassing.
So that was embarrassing.
So that was embarrassing.
So that was embarrassing.
Let's see how it's going!
Have a week.
